0.title: It's any actress' dream: Urvashi Rautela on sharing screen with SRK
0.article_body: Actress Urvashi Rautela was recently spotted at Baba Siddique's Iftar party, which was also attended by celebrities including Shah Rukh Khan. When asked if she'd like to work with actor Shah Rukh Khan, Urvashi said, "I would really wish and wait for the opportunity to share screen opposite Shahrukh Khan. It's any actress' dream. Hope that happens soon."

1.title: Shweta responds to trolls in new post, asks 'Tere baap ka kya jaata hai'
1.article_body: Actress Shweta Tiwari has responded to trolls who question her for laughing too much in pictures with a new post on Instagram. The actress shared pictures of herself laughing and captioned it, "They (trolls): 'Itna kya hans rahi hai! (Why are you laughing so much) Us: 'tere Baap ka kya jaata hai (what has your father got to lose)'."

2.title: Russia-backed Moldovan breakaway region says shots fired from Ukraine
2.article_body: Moldova's pro-Russian breakaway region of Transdniestria claimed on Wednesday that shots from Ukraine were fired towards its village Cobasna, which houses an ammunition depot. Transdniestria further claimed that several Ukrainian drones had been detected flying over Cobasna. This comes days after Moldova accused Russia of seeking to recruit its citizens from the region to fight in Ukraine war.

3.title: Don't oppose every step just to appear on TV: Mann to Opposition
3.article_body: Reacting to Opposition's criticism on Knowledge Sharing Agreement signed between Delhi-Punjab government, Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann said, "Opposition parties should not oppose every step being taken just to appear on TV." "Opposition parties should give us time," he added. "Navjot Singh Sidhu is questioning us on Power Purchase Agreements. When he was made Power Minister, he ran away," Mann said.

4.title: Malaysia to lift COVID-19 curbs including outdoor mask rule from May
4.article_body: Malaysia's Health Minister Khairy Jamaluddin on Wednesday said that the country will ease more COVID-19 restrictions, including scrapping the need to wear masks outdoors from the start of May. He, however, said that masks will remain mandatory for indoor activities and on public transport. People will now be able to enter public premises regardless of their vaccination status, Jamaluddin added.

5.title: Ram Charan visits Vijayawada's Kanakadurgamma Temple ahead of Acharya's release
5.article_body: Ram Charan and director Koratala Siva visited the Kanakadurgamma Temple in Vijayawada to offer prayers before Acharya's release on April 29. While the 'RRR' actor wore an all-black kurta pyjama look yet again, Siva was clicked in a semi-formal look with a shirt and denim. Yesterday, actors Chiranjeevi and Ram Charan were spotted in Hyderabad to promote 'Acharya'.

6.title: There's no action hero of my age in H'wood, want to try my luck there: Tiger
6.article_body: Tiger Shroff said there's a void in terms of a young action hero in Hollywood, adding "[There are] Tom Cruise and Jackie Chan, but there isn't any action hero...of my age group." "It's been a while since [I've] seen somebody with that skill set...portraying action or the kind of action I do...But that's my goal...to...try my luck in...Hollywood," he said.

7.title: Greece to help neighbour Bulgaria after Russia cuts gas supply
7.article_body: Greece will help Bulgaria deal with the new situation caused by the Russian decision to halt gas supplies to the country, Greek PM Kyriakos Mitsotakis told his Bulgarian counterpart Kiril Petkov during a phone call. Petkov said that Mitsotakis has assured him that a long-delayed gas link between the two neighbours, the Interconnector Greece-Bulgaria (IGB), will be ready by June.

8.title: Give Karim Benzema the Ballon d'Or: Ex-Real Madrid player Mesut Özil
8.article_body: Reacting to Real Madrid forward Karim Benzema's brace in the first leg of Real Madrid's Champions League semi-final against Manchester City, ex-Real Madrid player Mesut Özil tweeted, "Give...Benzema the Ballon d'Or." Manchester City defeated Real Madrid 4-3 in the first leg with Kevin De Bruyne, Gabriel Jesus, Phil Foden and Bernardo Silva scoring for City.

9.title: BJP never promotes riots but stops them: Madhya Pradesh Minister
9.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Cabinet Minister and BJP leader Vishvas Kailash Sarang has said that "BJP never promotes riots but stops them". This comes after Congress' Digvijaya Singh alleged that BJP is paying poor Muslim youth to pelt stones, adding, "These aren't facts...I'm not accusing anyone." Reacting to Singh's statement, Sarang asked, "How could you level such charges when you...don't have proof."

10.title: I'm bravest actor, what have I left that someone else could do: Ayushmann
10.article_body: When asked about who he thinks is the bravest actor, Ayushmann Khurrana named himself and said he thinks he's the bravest of all. "Whom should I name who can be called braver than me...what have I left that...someone else could have done or thought of doing? But I envy certain characters like Ranbir Kapoor in Rockstar and Barfi," he added.

11.title: Focus should be on stopping fighting: Jaishankar on Ukraine war
11.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said the best way to deal with the Ukraine conflict would be to focus on "stopping the fighting and getting the talking" to move forward. He added that India's position on the crisis is best placed to advance such an approach. India has not yet publicly condemned Russia's invasion and has called for dialogue-based resolution.

12.title: I always say that: Salah on whether he is the world's best player
12.article_body: Talking about whether he believes he is the best player in the world, Liverpool forward Mohamed Salah said, "In my mind, yes, I am always saying that...I don't choose anyone other than me." Salah is currently the highest goal-scorer in the ongoing 2021/22 season of the Premier League, having scored 22 goals so far. He has recorded 13 assists.

13.title: BJP targeting the NCP, misusing ED and CBI: Supriya Sule
13.article_body: NCP MP Supriya Sule accused the BJP of targeting the NCP and misusing Central agencies such as ED and CBI against its political opponents. "How is raking up issues like loudspeakers at places of worship going to benefit Maharashtra?" she questioned the BJP. Polarisation through communal unrest would only impact the country's economic growth and development, she added.

14.title: Political asylum only for homeless, I have home in Cong: KV Thomas
14.article_body: Congress leader KV Thomas on Wednesday rejected CPI(M) Kerala secretary Kodiyeri Balakrishnan's invitation to join the party, stating that he has a home in Congress, adding that political asylum is for the homeless. "Party positions are like tables and chairs. If that is taken away and I am given a stool, I have no problem with that," he said.

15.title: Man tries to sacrifice daughter for treasure in Maha; 9 arrested
15.article_body: Police have arrested nine persons for allegedly trying to sacrifice an 18-year-old in order to find hidden treasure in Maharashtra's Yavatmal. The victim's father had started performing tantrik rituals over the last few days and had dug a pit to bury his daughter, an official said. The victim somehow managed to inform her friend who subsequently informed the police.

16.title: K'taka Home Minister protecting PSI scam accused: DK Shivakumar
16.article_body: Karnataka Congress chief DK Shivakumar on Wednesday alleged that state Home Minister Araga Jnanendra is protecting the main accused in the Police Sub-Inspector (PSI) recruitment scam. "Government should give a notice to Jnanendra...for providing protection to Divya Hagaragi (prime accused)," he said. CM Basavaraj Bommai had earlier said that everything related to the PSI scam would be probed.

17.title: 'Mohammadpur is Madhavpuram now': Delhi BJP chief puts up board
17.article_body: Delhi BJP chief Adesh Gupta on Wednesday said that the name of south Delhi's Mohammadpur village has been changed to Madhavpuram. He said that since the Aam Aadmi Party-led government did not act on the proposal submitted by the South Delhi Municipal Corporation in December, the party members have renamed the place on their own.

18.title: China opposes US warship’s passage through Taiwan Strait
18.article_body: The People's Liberation Army (PLA) of China on Wednesday released a statement opposing the passage of a US warship - USS Sampson guided-missile destroyer - through the Taiwan Strait. "The US has been frequently carrying out provocative acts to send wrong signals to 'Taiwan Independence' forces, deliberately undermining peace and stability across the Taiwan Strait," said the statement.

19.title: Sadhguru is on global tour, he didn't meet Will Smith: Sadhguru's team
19.article_body: After several reports claimed that Hollywood star Will Smith was recently in India to meet Sadhguru after the Chris Rock slap controversy, Sadhguru's media relations team confirmed that the news isn't true. They said, "Sadhguru is on a global tour to promote Save Soil Movement. Sadhguru has not met Will Smith recently."

20.title: There’s probably a lot of people praying for my downfall: Naomi Osaka
20.article_body: Ex-world number one Naomi Osaka tweeted that probably there are a lot of people "praying [for her] downfall", but she doesn't feel it as the love overpowers everything. Osaka is a four-time Grand Slam champion. She is the first Japanese tennis player to win Australian Open having won the tournament in 2019. Osaka has played in four tournaments in 2022.

21.title: Instagram tests feature to let users pin posts to their profile
21.article_body: Instagram is testing a new feature to let users pin specific posts to their profile above their photo grid. Users who have access to the feature in the test phase are seeing a 'Pin to your profile' option that can be selected from the three-dot menu next to posts. Currently, users have the option to pin Stories to their profiles.

22.title: Chandigarh to seek French experts' help to protect 12,000 heritage items
22.article_body: The Chandigarh Administration has decided to ask for help from French experts in preserving and protecting its 12,000 heritage items. Reports said that the heritage items may be sold abroad for lakhs. "We will seek their help and have detailed discussion on the issue...we will ask them to help us technologically to protect the items," UT Adviser Dharam Pal said.

23.title: Power company engineer held for taking bribe in Madhya Pradesh
23.article_body: A junior engineer of a government-owned power company was caught red-handed while taking bribe to settle an electricity-related case in Madhya Pradesh on Wednesday. The accused, identified as Virendra Singh Chouhan, was posted in Narsinghpur. According to an EOW official, Chouhan had allegedly demanded ₹15,000 to settle a case related to seizure of electric wires from the complainant's farm.

24.title: Syria's humanitarian situation remains dire amid economic crisis: UN
24.article_body: The UN deputy emergency relief coordinator, Joyce Msuya, on Tuesday said humanitarian situation in Syria remains dire amid a worsening economic crisis in the country. Msuya said, "As the eyes of the world turn to other conflicts, Syria is on the verge of becoming yet another forgotten crisis despite millions of Syrians struggling each month to survive."

25.title: Denmark arrests man for promoting Islamic State on social media
25.article_body:
A man was arrested on Wednesday in Denmark on suspicion of violating the country's anti-terrorism laws by allegedly promoting the Islamic State group on social media. Police gave no other details except 
that the domestic security agency PET was involved in the operation. Last month, PET had said that Denmark's "biggest terrorist threat" remains people who sympathise with Islamic militants.

26.title: Man rapes cow in UP, arrested after neighbour finds CCTV footage
26.article_body: A man in Lucknow has been arrested for allegedly sexually assaulting a cow. The complainant alleged that the man was seen having sex with the cow on Saturday in CCTV footage. The neighbour then informed the owner of the cow after which a search party was formed by the locals to apprehend the accused.

27.title: 17-year-old Pune girl found 3-month pregnant, rape case filed against husband, father
27.article_body: Pune Police filed a case of rape and invoked anti-child marriage legislation after receiving report from a government hospital of a 17-year-old girl being three months pregnant. Police have booked the girl's 19-year-old husband and father. Police said that they have provided counsellor support to the girl and were in contact with both families to sensitively deal with the situation.

28.title: Only mom & I live in my mansion, I wander in the house at night: Nawazuddin
28.article_body: In a new video posted by RJ Siddharth Kannan, he gave a quick tour of Nawazuddin Siddiqui's Mumbai mansion. The video also included audio clips of their conversation about the actor's home. In the clip, Nawazuddin is heard saying, "Only my mother and I live in this house. At night, when I'm unable to sleep...I wander around like a ghost."

29.title: I will choose Cristiano Ronaldo over Lionel Messi in my team: Kaka
29.article_body: Ex-Real Madrid footballer Kaka said he will choose Cristiano Ronaldo over Lionel Messi in his team, adding that the chances of Ronaldo's failure are very less as he is very determined and focused. "Messi is a genius and Ronaldo has a very strong mentality," stated Kaka. Ronaldo currently represents Manchester United having earlier played for Real Madrid and Juventus.

30.title: Stopped from thrashing wife, UP man sets mom ablaze; consumes poison
30.article_body: A man in Uttar Pradesh's Bhadohi allegedly set his 60-year-old mother on fire after she stopped him from thrashing his wife. The accused, Mahajan, later consumed poison himself. While his mother died, Mahajan is struggling for life. Reports said Mahajan used to pressure his mother to empty her room as he wanted to stay there with his wife and children.

31.title: Why do you dub your movies in Hindi if it's not our national language: Ajay to Sudeep
31.article_body: Actor Ajay Devgn has reacted to Kannada actor Kiccha Sudeep's remark that Hindi is "no more" a national language. Ajay tweeted, "According to you, if Hindi is not our national language then why do you release your mother tongue movies by dubbing them in Hindi?" Ajay added, "Hindi was, is and always will be our mother tongue and national language."

32.title: 'Hobbit' human ancestors may be hiding on Indonesian island: Anthropologist
32.article_body: An anthropologist retired from the University of Alberta has claimed that "Hobbit" human ancestors or Homo floresiensis may still be hiding on an Indonesian island. Studies over the years concluded that they went extinct some 12,000 years ago. Gregory Forth's book includes sighting reports from over 30 eyewitnesses, with whom he spoke directly.

33.title: ‘Heropanti 2’ is not muddy and dirty, every frame is slick: Tiger Shroff
33.article_body: Talking about his upcoming film ‘Heropanti 2’, actor Tiger Shroff said, “‘Heropanti 2’ is not muddy and dirty, every frame is slick.” “It has the vibe of say ‘Mission Impossible’ meets ‘James Bond’ meets ‘War’,” added Tiger. Discussing movies from the ‘Baaghi’ franchise in which he stars as well, Tiger stated that ‘Baaghi’ was raw and rustic.

34.title: India's alternative fuels sector to create 50-60 lakh jobs: Gadkari
34.article_body: Union Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari said the alternative fuels sector will create 50-60 lakh jobs in India. He added that green hydrogen is the way forward and in the future, India will lead the world in this space. "My request to all manufacturers is that we need green hydrogen, because the government has a commitment for the environment," he stated.

35.title: Pak PM’s pre-arrest bail extended in money laundering case
35.article_body: A Pakistani court on Wednesday extended the pre-arrest bail granted to PM Shehbaz Sharif and his son Hamza Shehbaz, who is Punjab CM-elect, in a PKR 14 billion (₹574 crore) money laundering case. The PM was also granted exemption from appearing in person before the court. Sharif and his two sons were booked by Pakistan's Federal Investigation Agency in 2020.

36.title: UN chief Antonio Guterres condemns Karachi blast that killed 4
36.article_body: United Nations Secretary-General Antonio Guterres on Tuesday condemned the attack that occurred inside the premises of the University of Karachi in Pakistan and expressed his condolences, said his Deputy spokesman, Farhan Haq. Three Chinese nationals were among the four persons who were killed in the blast. The blast reportedly occurred in a van near the gate of the Confucius Institute.

37.title: Nepal bans import of 10 items, including cars, amid forex crisis
37.article_body: Nepal has banned import of 10 luxurious items, including cars and diamonds, amid its depleting foreign exchange reserves. The ban, which will be in place until end of this fiscal year in mid-July, will include other items such as liquor, cigarette and tobacco products and motorcycles. Earlier this month, Nepal urged citizens living abroad to deposit funds in domestic banks.

38.title: Climate change risking 10-18% of South Asia's GDP: Study
38.article_body: Climate change could see 10-18% of GDP of South Asian countries like India, Bangladesh and Pakistan lost by 2050, a study by ratings firm S&P Global revealed. This is 10 times the risk to Europe and three times the risk to North America. Overall, climate change could put 4% of global GDP at risk by 2050, the report stated.

39.title: Would've liked Will Smith but not now: Henry on which actor should play him
39.article_body: Ex-Arsenal forward Thierry Henry said he would have earlier liked to name Will Smith as the actor who should portray him in a film, but will not do so now. "I would go [with] Chris Tucker," added Henry. Smith recently resigned from the Oscars Academy after slapping Chris Rock at Oscars, for making a joke about his wife Jada Pinkett.

40.title: I'm part of Salman Khan's 'Kabhi Eid Kabhi Diwali': Aayush Sharma
40.article_body: Actor Aayush Sharma has confirmed that he will be joining Salman Khan in the film 'Kabhi Eid Kabhi Diwali', which will be directed by Farhad Samji. "Yes, I am a part of the film and I'm looking forward to experimenting with my cinematic aptitude with this project," Aayush stated. The duo previously shared screen space in 'Antim: The Final Truth'.

41.title: 3 men, including boyfriend, rape minor girl in Nagpur; arrested
41.article_body: A minor girl was allegedly gang-raped by her boyfriend and two of his friends in Nagpur, following which the three were arrested. On April 17, the accused shared intimate videos he had recorded without the girl's permission with his friends and used them to ask for sexual favours for the two. The group then allegedly gang-raped the minor, reports said.

42.title: Justin Lin steps down as 'Fast X' director after 10 yrs with franchise
42.article_body: Justin Lin has stepped down as the director of 'Fast X' after being associated with the franchise for 10 years. In a statement released by the franchise's official Twitter handle, Justin said, "I've made the difficult decision to step back as director of 'Fast X'." "Over 10 years...five films, we've been able to shoot the best actors...stunts...car chases," he added.

43.title: Reduce central excise first: Cong on PM's appeal to states to reduce VAT on fuel
43.article_body: Reacting to PM Narendra Modi's appeal to CMs of Maharashtra, West Bengal, Telangana, Andhra Pradesh, Kerala, Jharkhand and Tamil Nadu to reduce VAT on petrol and diesel, Congress said that he should first reduce central excise. "(Centre) earned ₹26 lakh crore out of central excise...(and) didn't give the GST share to the states on time," Congress' Pawan Khera said.

44.title: Man, wife stabbed to death in UP's Muzaffarnagar over old rivalry
44.article_body: A 50-year-old man and his 48-year-old wife were allegedly stabbed to death by three people in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar over an old rivalry, police said on Wednesday. The accused pulled the victims out of an e-rickshaw and killed them, police added. The husband and his two sons were arrested in a murder case in June 2021, police stated.

45.title: EU accuses Russia of blackmail as it cuts gas to Poland & Bulgaria
45.article_body: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen said that Russia's decision to stop delivering gas to Bulgaria and Poland is "an instrument of blackmail". The move is "unjustified and unacceptable" and shows the unreliability of Russia as a gas supplier, she added. The EU is working on a coordinated response to the escalation by Moscow, she further said.

46.title: 5 killed, 1 injured as SUV falls into canal in Punjab's Ludhiana
46.article_body: As many as five persons were killed and one was injured as the SUV they were travelling in fell into the Sidhwan canal in Punjab's Ludhiana, police said. The SUV's doors got locked inside the water and by the time the victims were taken out from the canal, they were all dead, except one, police added.

47.title: Warner Bros officially announces 'The Batman 2' at the CinemaCon 2022
47.article_body: Hollywood studio Warner Bros has officially announced a sequel to Robert Pattinson-starrer 'The Batman' during a presentation at the CinemaCon 2022 on Tuesday. "Matt Reeves (director), Robert and the entire team will be taking audiences back to Gotham with 'The Batman 2'," Warner Bros Pictures Group chief Toby Emmerich said. The 2022 film also featured Zoe Kravitz and Colin Farrell.

48.title: Musk's ideas would be great for Twitter: Largest ad group WPP CEO
48.article_body: World's largest advertising group WPP CEO Mark Read in an interview with Bloomberg Television discussed Elon Musk's Twitter deal, saying, "Many of his ideas around fake bots, and improving the algorithms...would be great for the platform, great for users and great for our clients," Read said. He added he doesn't expect any potential crackdown on advertising on Twitter in future.

49.title: Copied some moves from Abhishek's dancing as a kid: Big B on 'Khaike Paan...'
49.article_body: Actor Amitabh Bachchan said on Instagram that some of his dance steps in the song 'Khaike Paan Banaraswala' from his film 'Don', were "copied" from son Abhishek Bachchan's sideways movement as a kid. "Haha, still moving sideways," read the reaction from Abhishek to the post shared by Amitabh, which featured a clip of him dancing to the song.

50.title: LIC to reserve 10% of IPO size for policyholders
50.article_body: Life Insurance Corporation (LIC) on Wednesday announced that it will be reserving 10% of its IPO size, or 2.21 crore shares, for policyholders. Additionally, policyholders will be offered a discount of ₹60/share while employees and retail investors will be offered a discount of ₹45/share. The maximum bid amount under the Policyholder Reservation Portion must not exceed ₹2 lakh.

51.title: Kerala University distributes answer key instead of paper, Guv seeks report
51.article_body: Kerala Governor Arif Mohammed Khan has sought a report after the answer key was distributed instead of question paper to students in an exam at Kerala University. The Governor has also sought a report after exams were postponed at Kannur University when it was found that the previous year's question papers have been repeated once again this year.

52.title: BJP, VHP hold protest march in Raj against Alwar temple demolition
52.article_body: BJP, VHP and other Hindu organisations on Wednesday held a protest march in Rajasthan against the demolition of a 300-year-old Shiva temple in Alwar. BJP MP Balaknath said, "We've demanded...action against involved officers, construction of the demolished temple and resignation of Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot." Notably, the state government has suspended three officials over the temple's demolition.

53.title: 500+ left homeless as fire at Manesar scrapyard destroys 100+ shanties
53.article_body: After a massive fire broke out in a scrapyard in sector 6 of IMT Manesar on Monday night, over 100 hutments were destroyed, leaving over 500 people homeless. A 48-year-old woman was also killed in the incident. A resident of the area said that she and her family had to leave everything, including ₹1.5 lakh case they had saved, behind.

54.title: Masks made mandatory in Kerala amid COVID surge, violation punishable
54.article_body: Amid rise in COVID-19 cases, the Kerala government on Wednesday made wearing of masks mandatory. In its latest order, the government has said that any violation to the rule will be punishable. State Health Minister Veena George had earlier said that the government would  "continue to remain vigilant since other states are reporting an increase in the number of cases".

55.title: Deepika Padukone to be part of Cannes Film Festival 2022 jury
55.article_body: Actress Deepika Padukone will be a part of the main jury at the Cannes Film Festival this year. The jury for the festival's 75th edition will be presided over by French actor Vincent Lindon. Lindon, along with the jury members, will reward one of the 21 films in competition with the Palme d'or, on May 28, during the closing ceremony.

56.title: Which overseas players have recorded most ducks in IPL?
56.article_body: With his golden duck against RR, Glenn Maxwell recorded his 12th duck in the history of IPL. It is the most number of ducks by an overseas cricketer. He overtook Rashid Khan, who has 11 IPL ducks to his name. Sunil Narine and AB de Villiers have been dismissed on a duck 10 times each.

57.title: Michael Slater avoids jail in domestic violence case, sent to mental health hospital
57.article_body: Former Australia cricketer Michael Slater avoided jail on Wednesday after a court in Sydney dismissed domestic violence charges against him on mental health grounds. The court has ordered Slater to spend three weeks in a mental health hospital. Slater has been arrested multiple times for domestic violence against his ex-girlfriend.

58.title: I think I broke 3-4 remote controls: Ricky Ponting on RR-DC match
58.article_body: Referring to RR-DC match which he missed due to quarantine, DC head coach Ricky Ponting said, "It was frustrating. I think I broke three or four remote controls." He added, "When you're on sidelines...being a coach...and you can't control what's happening out in the middle...that's hard enough...but when you're not actually at ground...it can get a little more frustrating."

59.title: NCPCR seeks report as B'luru school allegedly asks kids to carry Bible
59.article_body: The National Commission for Protection of Child Rights (NCPCR) has sought a report from the district administration after a Bengaluru school allegedly asked children to carry Bibles. Right-wing group Hindu Janajagruti Samiti had alleged the school took an undertaking from parents to allow students to carry Bibles. The group's members also met Karnataka Education Minister BC Nagesh over the matter.

60.title: They will feel 'really hurt': Daniel Vettori on RCB's 29-run loss vs RR
60.article_body: Discussing RCB's defeat by 29 runs against RR having been handed a target of 145, ex-RCB captain Daniel Vettori said the RCB players will feel "really hurt" by the performance of their batters. "RCB's bowling unit...[was] fantastic and disciplined," added Vettori. RCB were bowled out for 115 with captain Faf Du Plessis their highest run-getter, having scored 23 runs.

61.title: Kohli has experienced these highs and lows before too: Bangar
61.article_body: RCB head coach Sanjay Bangar has said Virat Kohli has experienced "highs and lows many times before" and he'll soon emerge from "this run of low scores". Bangar added, "Kohli is so mentally strong, he'll be able to put in better performance [in upcoming games]." Kohli has scored 128 runs in nine games so far this season.

62.title: I'll go if I lose majority in Parliament: SL PM amid resignation calls
62.article_body: Sri Lanka PM Mahinda Rajapaksa has said that he will only step down if he loses the majority in the Parliament. Anti-government protesters in Sri Lanka are demanding the PM and his younger brother President Gotabaya Rajapaksa's resignation over the island nation's worsening economic crisis. The crisis has led to a shortage of essential items in the country.

63.title: PM Narendra Modi inaugurates children's heart hospital in Fiji
63.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday inaugurated the Sri Sathya Sai Sanjeevani Children's Heart Hospital in Fiji via video conferencing. "I express my gratitude to the Prime Minister of Fiji and the people of Fiji for this," he added. "This is a symbol of our traditional relationship and another chapter in the shared journey of India-Fiji," PM Modi further said.

64.title: Thieves in business attire fly from Delhi to Kochi to rob big houses; arrested
64.article_body: The police have arrested a trio of thieves who landed in Kerala's Kochi from Delhi in business attire to rob big houses. They allegedly carried out thefts in four houses on consecutive days from April 21, reports say. Approximately 160 gm of gold ornaments amounting to ₹8 lakh, ₹70,000 cash, $411 and wristwatches including a Rolex were recovered from them.

65.title: It worries me a lot more than the 68 all out: Bishop on RCB's loss vs RR
65.article_body: Reacting to RCB's loss by 29 runs against RR, ex-West Indies pacer Ian Bishop said the defeat worries him a "lot more" than the team being bowled out for 68 runs, in their previous match against SRH. "I am still not seeing Virat Kohli getting the runs that he needs to get for this team to prosper," added Bishop.

66.title: Delhi school near Bhalswa landfill shut due to toxic smoke after fire
66.article_body: Delhi's Gyan Sarovar School has been temporarily closed after a massive fire broke out at Bhalswa landfill site on Tuesday. "It's not safe to keep children here because of the smoke...We've decided to keep the school closed for a week," a community organiser said. Locals living near the area complained of breathing and visibility issues, as per ANI report.

67.title: PM Modi asks states to audit hospitals to prevent fire incidents
67.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday asked all states to ensure safety audits of hospitals on a priority basis. "I urge all states to get safety audits of all hospitals done on a priority basis to prevent fire incidents which have been increasing amid heatwave. Our response time should also be minimal," he said during a COVID-19 review meeting with CMs.

68.title: When rules-based order was challenged in Asia, Europe advised us to do more trade: EAM
68.article_body: Defending India's stand on Russia-Ukraine conflict, EAM S Jaishankar told European leaders, "When the rules-based order was under challenge in Asia, the advice we got from Europe was do more trade. At least we're not giving you that advice." He added, "In terms of Afghanistan, please show me which part of the rules-based order justified what the world did there."

69.title: We shot at a place where shooting was termed impossible: 'Thar' director Raj
69.article_body: Sharing his experience while shooting his film 'Thar', director Raj Singh Chaudhary said, "It was a tough shoot in terms of terrain...One such location was...an 800-year-old structure." "The production [team] told me...it was impossible to shoot there [as it's in the middle of nowhere on top of the mountain]. I convinced them and the production [team]...created a road," added Raj.

70.title: Do well: Sushmita to fan who stalks her profile for motivation amid exam stress
70.article_body: Actress Sushmita Sen replied to a fan who stalked her on Instagram to get motivation amid exam stress. The user commented on her post stating, "My ICSE exams have started and I'm feeling...tensed right now. I'm...stalking your profile and reading the captions for some motivation." To which, Sushmita replied, "All the best jaan meri...study and do your best! You'll do...well."

71.title: 5 Pune mosques say no to DJ music during Eid amid loudspeaker row
71.article_body: Amid the ongoing controversy over usage of loudspeakers at religious places, authorities of five mosques in Pune have decided to shun DJ music during Eid al-Fitr celebration on May 2. The authorities also appealed to the community to avoid playing loud music during festival, adding that funds collected to procure the DJ systems should be used to aid needy people.

72.title: Delhi temperature likely to cross 44°C tomorrow, yellow alert issued
72.article_body: The temperature in Delhi is expected to cross the 42-degree mark today and 44-degree mark on Thursday. The India Meteorological Department has issued a yellow alert warning of a heatwave spell in the national capital, starting April 28. PTI also quoted an official as saying that the maximum temperature may leap to 46 degree Celsius in parts of Delhi.

73.title: I became over-sensitive: Eijaz Khan on challenges faced while growing up
73.article_body: Discussing the impact of challenges faced while growing up, actor Eijaz Khan said, "I became over-sensitive and...started working from a space of a victim." "I try to see that my childhood trauma or whatever traumas we face in our formative years, if it has put speed breakers...in my growth and relationships now, then I go for therapy," added Eijaz.

74.title: Delhi govt to develop over 2000 classrooms as 'hi-tech digital'
74.article_body: The Delhi government has announced its plan to develop over 2000 classrooms as 'hi-tech digital' facilities for students of classes 6 to 12 of government schools. About 2,211 classrooms will be developed as digital classrooms, with 75 inches or bigger interactive flat display panels, UHD resolution and touch screen. The estimated cost of the project is ₹65.43 crore, reports said.

75.title: New Delhi Railway Station's revamp to decongest CP: RLDA VC
75.article_body: New Delhi Railway Station's redevelopment will help in decongesting Connaught Place and is expected to generate revenue of ₹10,000-12,000 crore, Rail Land Development Authority (RLDA) VC VP Dudeja said. Under the project, a 40-storey commercial twin-tower will be built. Two multi-modal transport hubs, one on Ajmeri Gate side and another on Paharganj side, will also be developed, Dudeja added.

76.title: We cannot please other nations by being 'pale imitation' of what they are: India
76.article_body: Amid pressure from the West to take a strong stand on Russia's Ukraine invasion, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said, "I think it's better to engage with the world on the basis of who we are." He further said that India cannot please other nations by "being a pale imitation of what they are".

77.title: Country needs alternative agenda, not political regrouping: T'gana CM
77.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao on Wednesday said the country needs alternative agenda and not political fronts or political realignment. While addressing members on 21st foundation day of Telangana Rashtra Samithi (TRS), Rao said that he had turned down the idea of communist leaders to 'dislodge' the BJP, adding, the focus should not be on bringing down any party.

78.title: Mira Kapoor invests in organic grocery startup ﻿Zama Organics
78.article_body: Mira Kapoor has invested an undisclosed amount in organic and healthy grocery startup Zama Organics. Founded by Shriya Naheta Wadhwa, Zama Organics focuses on building a farm-to-table supply chain for organic and natural vegetables, fruits and groceries. It is backed by angel investors like BillDesk Director and Co-Founder Ajay Kaushal and Guardian Advisors Director Arjun Lamba, among others.

79.title: Something bad happens in Bollywood, then entire industry is b**ch: Ajay Devgn
79.article_body: Actor Ajay Devgn said that the entire industry is called b**ch if something bad happens [in Bollywood] like if "X person says something". "And maybe that person is not part of industry, he may be a so-called actor or struggler but the HL says Actor XYZ did," he said, adding, "People are like...why are...celebs quiet...because there is reaction to everything."

80.title: Speeding garbage truck hits bike in Mumbai, 16-year-old killed
80.article_body: A 16-year-old girl who was riding pillion on a bike with her 23-year-old friend died after a speeding garbage truck hit their two-wheeler on Mumbai's Western Express highway in Malad (East). The duo were on their way home when the truck hit them and the girl went under the wheels of the heavy vehicle, the police said.

81.title: Pune farmer hires helicopter to bring home newborn granddaughter
81.article_body: A farmer from Pune's Balewadi hired a helicopter to bring his newborn granddaughter and daughter-in-law home on Tuesday. The man, Ajit Pandurang Balwadkar, told reporters that he wanted to accord a special welcome to his granddaughter Krushika, who was residing at her maternal grandparents' house in Shewal Wadi. Balwadkar then sent a helicopter there to pick them up.

82.title: Mumtaz gets discharged from hospital, says 'I'm weak but I have recovered'
82.article_body: Veteran actress Mumtaz, who was admitted to hospital because of a severe stomach infection, has been discharged now. Speaking about it, Mumtaz said, "It was a very bad infection and I had to be hospitalised. I was there for a...week and now I'm back home, weak but fully recovered." "We need much better healthcare for the underprivileged," she added.

83.title: SDMC to start anti-encroachment drive in Delhi’s Jaitpur: Mayor
83.article_body: South Delhi Municipal Corporation (SDMC) Mayor Mukesh Suryan on Wednesday said that an anti-encroachment drive will soon be conducted in Delhi's Jaitpur. A team of SDMC officials reached the area for inspection before starting the drive. "There have been several complaints of illegal encroachment here…Some of them have been identified," said Suryan.

84.title: Man arrested for stalking PhD scholar on IISc campus in Bengaluru
84.article_body: A 30-year-old man has been arrested at the Indian Institute of Science, Bengaluru, for stalking a 27-year-old PhD scholar. According to the woman, the man was her former university mate and was deliberate to have a relationship with her, which she rejected. The man also allegedly posted the woman's pictures on his Facebook account, stating that she was his wife.

85.title: We're ticking all boxes to win matches, but lacking in execution: Shreyas Iyer
85.article_body: KKR captain Shreyas Iyer has said they're ticking all boxes to win matches in the ongoing IPL season but are lacking in the "execution part". He added, "It's just a matter of time once we get going, we'll be unstoppable as a team." He further said, "The qualifiers are at the Eden Gardens...we'll put in our 100 per cent."

86.title: Bihar groom among 3 injured after he opens fire at wedding event
86.article_body: An 18-year-old groom in Bihar’s Ara was among three persons injured when he and his friends fired shots in the air from a country-made revolver at a wedding event on Tuesday, police said. Bhojpur SP, Vinay Tiwary, said the groom and his friends will be arrested. The injured persons include the groom’s 12-year-old nephew and another relative.

87.title: LIC to reserve 10% of IPO offer for policyholders, 5% for employees
87.article_body: Life Insurance Corporation (LIC) will be reserving 10% of the IPO offer size, or 2.21 crore shares, for policyholders with one or more policies as on date of IPO prospectus submission. Employees, however, will have 5% of the post-offer equity share capital, or 15.81 lakh shares, reserved. For both policyholders and employees, the maximum bidding amount cannot exceed ₹2 lakh.

88.title: She sent texts saying she had depression, I have screenshots: Vijay on rape charges
88.article_body: Malayalam actor Vijay Babu, who has been booked for allegedly raping a woman, claimed innocence and said he's the real victim. "She sent several messages to me saying...she was suffering from depression. I have around 400 screenshots...I haven't sent...messages to that woman for the last one-and-a-half years," he said. Vijay Babu further said he'll file a defamation case against her.

89.title: What are the highlights of LIC's IPO announcement made today?
89.article_body: Shares in LIC IPO will be sold for ₹902-949 with a ₹60 discount for policyholders and ₹45 discount for retail investors and employees, from May 4-9. LIC's IPO will be India's largest, with the government diluting its 3.5% stake for ₹20,557 crore. 10% of offer size is reserved for policyholders and 0.7% for employees. Anchor quota opens on May 2.

90.title: Russia's decision to cut off gas will make it more isolated: UK
90.article_body: After Russia's Gazprom confirmed it was cutting off gas deliveries to Poland and Bulgaria, UK Deputy PM Dominic Raab said the move would've a "very damaging effect" on Russia itself. Moscow is becoming "more and more, not just...political pariah, but an economic pariah", Raab added. Gazprom halted gas supplies to Poland and Bulgaria after they refused to pay in roubles.

91.title: COVID-19 cases rising in some states, need to be alert: PM Modi to CMs
91.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday told the Chief Ministers of several states that the "COVID challenge has yet not been surpassed." "We are seeing an uptick in COVID cases in some states now, we need to stay alert," PM Modi said. "Administering vaccines to every eligible child at the earliest should be our priority," PM Modi told the Chief Ministers.

92.title: Reliance Industries becomes 1st Indian company to hit ₹19 lakh crore m-cap
92.article_body: Mukesh Ambani's Reliance Industries (RIL) on Wednesday became the first Indian company to cross ₹19 lakh crore in market capitalisation. The company's stock jumped to a record high of ₹2,827.10 during intra-day trade on Wednesday. However, the ₹19 lakh crore market capitalisation milestone was briefly held by the company as the shares slid and were last trading at ₹2,781.65.

93.title: Never saw Kohli travel in business class as captain: Ex-cricketer Vivek Razdan
93.article_body: Talking about Virat Kohli, former cricketer Vivek Razdan said that he never saw Kohli travel in business class when he was the captain despite one seat on the flight being reserved for the captain. Razdan added, "Kohli always preferred to be with his teammates in economy class...There was always a bowler occupying [his] business class seat."

94.title: PM Modi urges several states to cut VAT on petrol and diesel
94.article_body: PM Narendra Modi urged several states to cut VAT on petrol and diesel in spirit of cooperative federalism. PM Modi stated states like Maharashtra, West Bengal, Telangana, Andhra Pradesh, Tamil Nadu, Kerala and Jharkhand didn't cut VAT on petrol and diesel in November 2021 when Centre had cut tax on fuel prices. He added that it had affected the citizens.

95.title: 28-yr-old gangster carrying highest reward by Delhi Police arrested
95.article_body: A 28-year-old gangster, identified as Shahrukh who was carrying the highest reward by the Delhi Police of ₹2 lakh, was arrested along with his three associates from Chhatarpur on Monday. "They were found in possession of sophisticated firearms and live ammunition," police said. Shahrukh was involved in 10 criminal cases of murder, attempt to murder and extortion, among others.

96.title: Wrapped up in 2004, Ajay Devgn's 'Naam' to release after 18 years: Report
96.article_body: Ajay Devgn starrer 'Naam' that was reportedly wrapped up in 2004 is ready for a release this summer, reports said, adding that the makers are eyeing May-July for the release of the film. "Naam is truly special for me because it...marks fourth collaboration of Ajay and Anees post 'Deewangee', 'Pyaar To Hona Hi Tha' and 'Hulchul'," producer Anil Roongta said.

97.title: Umran has been improving ever since he started working with Steyn: Parthiv
97.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Parthiv Patel has said SRH pacer Umran Malik has been improving under their bowling coach Dale Steyn. "It feels like Umran is setting up batters now. Earlier, he used to just bowl with raw pace. He is learning how to pick wickets under Steyn," added Parthiv. So far, Umran has picked 10 wickets in seven games.

98.title: This is dumb: Kim reacts to fans' claims that she photoshopped her poolside pics
98.article_body: American media personality Kim Kardashian reacted to accusations that said she photoshopped her poolside pictures. Taking to Instagram Stories, she wrote, "Come on guys...Seriously! This is so dumb! Claiming I photoshopped out my belly button?" In another Story, she wrote, "Belly button insecurities?! Why don't you head over to skims.com to conceal that saggy belly button of yours."

99.title: SpaceX launches its Crew 4 astronauts to International Space Station
99.article_body: SpaceX has successfully launched its Crew 4 mission astronauts to the International Space Station atop its Falcon 9 rocket. The crew consists of Kjell Lindgren, Robert Hines, Jessica Watkins, and Samantha Cristoforetti, who will spend six months aboard the ISS. With this mission, Watkins will become the first Black woman to serve aboard the space station.

100.title: 7 held following man's death after fight with bar staff in Noida mall
100.article_body: Seven people have been arrested in the case relating to the death of a man after a fight with the bar staff at a pub in Noida's Gardens Galleria mall. Those arrested include five staff members and two from the security team. The postmortem report had revealed that the victim died of a severe head injury and a fractured spleen.

101.title: Bengaluru RWAs oppose demand of restaurants, pubs being open 24/7
101.article_body: Resident Welfare Associations (RWAs) in Bengaluru are opposing the demand for allowing restaurants and pubs to stay open round the clock. People's night sleep is disturbed as "establishments have squeezed into even residential areas and operate till late hours with loud music", RWAs said. "You want to enjoy life 24x7? Go to 5-star hotel...Leave us in peace," RWAs activist said.

102.title: Auto driver arrested for sexually harassing 12-year-old girl in Pune
102.article_body: Police have arrested a 33-year-old auto driver for sexually harassing a 12-year-old girl and making obscene gestures after approaching her on the pretext of enquiring about an address on April 22 in Pune. The incident reportedly happened when the girl was returning from private tuition classes. The driver was arrested following an extensive manhunt after the girl's parents filed complaint.

103.title: 4 of family killed, 2 injured after bike hits bulldozer in Guj's Dahod
103.article_body: A labourer, his wife and their two minor sons were killed after their motorcycle hit a bulldozer which suddenly came in their way in Gujarat’s Dahod district on Tuesday evening, police said on Wednesday. Their two other children have suffered injuries. The bulldozer’s driver managed to escape after the accident, a police official said.

104.title: Ludhiana administration sets up donation corner for underprivileged kids
104.article_body: The Ludhiana district administration has set up a donation corner for underprivileged children outside the Deputy Commissioner’s office. The donation corner, which was inaugurated on Tuesday by Deputy Commissioner Surabhi Malik, comprises of a stationery ATM and a toys bank. The items donated by the public will be distributed among the needy.

105.title: Hands aren't moving, one was operated upon, other has IV: Chhavi after surgery
105.article_body: Actress Chhavi Mittal who recently had surgery after being diagnosed with breast cancer said that her hands are not moving. "One hand has been operated upon, one has IV, I am not moving them right now, but taking calls as much as I can," she said, adding that her family is worried but they feel better when she cracks jokes.

106.title: NASA's OSIRIS-REx spacecraft to visit a second asteroid
106.article_body: NASA's OSIRIS-REx spacecraft will get an extended mission to visit a second asteroid. NASA has extended the University of Arizona-led mission, which will be renamed OSIRIS-APEX, to study near-Earth asteroid Apophis for 18 months. The mission will make its first manoeuvre toward Apophis 30 days after the OSIRIS-REx spacecraft delivers the sample it collected from Bennu in October 2020.

107.title: At least 4 Syrian soldiers killed in Israeli airstrikes: Report
107.article_body: At least four Syrian soldiers were reportedly killed and a few others injured in airstrikes carried out by Israel. Several missiles struck near the Syrian capital, Damascus, in the pre-dawn hours of Wednesday, according to a Britain-based war monitor. The attacks came hours after Israel said that one of its drones had crashed on the Syrian side of the border.

108.title: So much pain, no amount of pain killer is helping: Actress Chhavi after cancer surgery
108.article_body: After undergoing breast cancer surgery, actress Chhavi Mittal said, "It's amazing how quickly we forget pain. The pain I felt after C section...or the excruciating pain of my back injury which also healed." "Right now there's so much pain that no amount of pain killer is helping. What's helping...is seeing the smiles on the faces of well wishers," she added.

109.title: Baby dies after slipping from nurse's hands in Lucknow, father told he was born dead
109.article_body: A newborn boy died after slipping from a nurse's hands at a private hospital in Lucknow. His father said, "I was told the baby was stillborn. However, when I spoke to my wife, she said she saw him alive." He added, "She saw a nurse taking the baby in her hands without any towel, when he slipped through her hand."

110.title: It's chauvinistic to ask if my husband is okay with me working: Actress Sana
110.article_body: Actress Sana Sayyad, who features in 'Spy Bahu', spoke about how questions about her husband's comfort with her profession reek of chauvinism. She said, "I don't like when people ask 'if your husband is comfortable with you working'." "That question is weird and is (chauvinistic). I'm not doing anything absurd for him to not like it," she added.

111.title: Samson wasting opportunities to press for India recall: Ian Bishop
111.article_body: Ex-WI fast bowler Ian Bishop has said RR captain Sanju Samson is "wasting good opportunities" due to his shot selection in the ongoing IPL season. Samson was playing on 27 against RCB when he attempted to play the standing reverse sweep on consecutive deliveries off Wanindu Hasaranga and got out. So far, Samson has scored 228 runs in eight games.

112.title: Man in Lucknow for a house-warming party molests minor girl in lift
112.article_body: A trader who had come to Lucknow for a house-warming party, allegedly molested a 12-year-old girl in the elevator of the apartment building. He reportedly ran away after the girl started screaming. The girl started crying when she reached home and told her mother about the incident, after which, her parents filed an FIR.

113.title: Musk usually does what he says he is going to do: Billionaire investor Novogratz
113.article_body: Billionaire investor Mike Novogratz has tweeted, "The hysteria around Elon Musk buying Twitter is unsettling. While his style might not be for everyone, he usually does what he says he is going to do." "Give him a chance to remove the bots. For that alone we will all be thanking him," Novogratz wrote.

114.title: Action should be taken if Twitter interferes with free speech in India: Tharoor
114.article_body: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor on Wednesday said if Twitter is found either "interfering" with free speech in India or the opposite by permitting hate speech and abuse, then the IT committee should take action. "On Elon Musk: Who owns which social media company is not our concern. What matters is what they do and how," Tharoor tweeted.

115.title: Return ₹2.8 cr to mining firm for not honouring contract: HC to Punjab
115.article_body: Punjab and Haryana High Court has directed the Punjab government to return about ₹2.8 crore to a mining firm for not honouring a 2017 contract. The firm had got the contract for Lubangarh but no mining work was done amid protests from locals. Notably, the contract was later cancelled and the amount deposited was forfeited.

116.title: 4 held with brown sugar worth ₹2 crore in West Bengal's Siliguri
116.article_body: The West Bengal police on Tuesday arrested four people with 1 kg of brown sugar worth ₹2 crore in Siliguri. Two of the arrested persons are from Nadia district while the other two are from Murshidabad. According to the police, the accused are members of an organised drug cartel involved in supplying drugs in North Bengal.

117.title: What is histrionic personality disorder that psychologist says actress Amber Heard has?
117.article_body: Histrionic personality disorder, that a psychologist said actress Amber Heard has, is also known as a dramatic personality disorder, as per US' National Library of Medicine. It is distinguished by a pattern of exaggerated attention-seeking behaviours. For people with histrionic personality disorder, their self-esteem depends on the approval of others, as per Cleveland Clinic.

118.title: Section 144 imposed to prevent 'Hindu Mahapanchayat' in U'khand's Dada Jalalpur
118.article_body: Haridwar District Magistrate Vinay Shankar Pandey has said that prohibitory orders under CrPC section 144 have been enforced in Dada Jalalpur village near Uttarakhand's Roorkee and in areas within its five-km radius where a 'Hindu Mahapanchayat' was scheduled to be held on Wednesday. "The gathering will not be allowed to be held at any cost," SSP Yogendra Singh Rawat said.

119.title: Ukraine demolishes monument depicting its friendship with Russia
119.article_body: Ukraine on Tuesday demolished a monument in Kyiv which represented its historic ties with Russia. This comes amid the ongoing war between the two countries. "It took some effort but the Soviet sculpture of the two workers - symbolising the reunification of Ukraine and Russia - was dismantled," Kyiv Mayor Vitali Klitschko was quoted as saying.

120.title: Product of 'parivarvad' can't be sold: BJP on Prashant Kishor not joining Cong
120.article_body: Reacting to the Congress' announcement that poll strategist Prashant Kishor has declined the offer to join the party, BJP spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla said that Congress' agenda is "parivar bachao (save the family)". "If the product is bad, no matter how good a salesman (might) be...you can't sell the product of parivarvad (dynasty politics) past its expiry date," he said.

121.title: Can't breathe, govt should take action: Locals near Bhalswa dump yard
121.article_body: Locals who live near Bhalswa dump yard, where a fire broke out on Tuesday, said that they are not able to breathe or see properly and that the government should take proper action on the situation of the dump yard, ANI reported. Reports also said that the dump yard was sending a dense plume of smoke into the sky.

122.title: Google-parent Alphabet's Q1 profit drops by over $1 billion
122.article_body: Google-parent Alphabet's net profit dropped to $16.4 billion in the first quarter compared to last year's $17.9 billion in the same quarter. Its revenue shot up 23% from the same period last year, reaching $68 billion. The company reported $54.66 billion in advertising revenue for the quarter, up from $44.68 billion the year prior.

123.title: 'Hate-in-India', Make-in-India can't coexist: Rahul Gandhi to PM Modi
123.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday tweeted about the exit of some global brands from India. "Modi ji, Hate-in-India and Make-in-India can't coexist!" he wrote on Twitter. The former Congress chief also shared a picture showing seven global brands, including Chevrolet, Harley Davidson, Man Trucks, Fiat, United Motors, Ford and Datsun, which have exited the country.

124.title: PM Modi to visit Germany, Denmark & France next week
124.article_body: PM Narendra Modi will be travelling to Germany, Denmark, and France between May 2-4, the Ministry of External Affairs said, adding, "This will be PM's first visit abroad in 2022." During his visit, he'll hold talks with German Chancellor Olaf Scholz and Denmark PM Mette Frederiksen, attend second India-Nordic Summit being hosted by Denmark, and meet French President Emmanuel Macron.

125.title: We're close to turning it all around: Ponting on DC losing 4 of their 7 games
125.article_body: DC head coach Ricky Ponting has said they need to get momentum as they're close to turning it around in IPL 2022. "There's 36 or 37 overs of really good stuff...[but] we just let it slip for two or three overs...we've got to believe...And things will definitely change for us," he added. DC have lost 4 of their 7 games.

126.title: India's largest IPO of LIC to open on May 4, price band ₹902-949 per share
126.article_body: Life Insurance Corporation's (LIC) IPO will open on May 4 and close on May 9, the company confirmed on Wednesday. The price band will be ₹902-949, with a ₹60 discount for policyholders and ₹45 discount for retail investors and employees. The IPO, through which the government is selling its 3.5% LIC stake to raise ₹20,557 crore, will be India's largest.

127.title: Air India proposes to acquire AirAsia India
127.article_body: Tata-owned Air India has proposed to acquire AirAsia India and has sought the deal's approval from the Competition Commission of India. AirAsia India is majority-owned by Tata Sons with a shareholding of 83.67% and the remaining stake is with AirAsia Investment Ltd (AAIL), part of Malaysia's AirAsia Group. Air India and Air India Express were acquired by Tata last year.

128.title: None of us should give advice to him, let the GOAT do his thing: RR's Riyan on idol Kohli
128.article_body: RR all-rounder Riyan Parag, who smashed a match-winning 56*(31) against RCB, reacted to ESPNcricinfo's tweet asking their followers about what advice they'd give to Virat Kohli amid his poor form. "None of us should, let the GOAT (Greatest of All Time) do his thing," Riyan wrote. The 20-year-old all-rounder considers Kohli as his idol.

129.title: MP Navneet Rana took loan of ₹80 lakh from builder Yusuf Lakdawala: Raut
129.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut has alleged that Maharashtra's Amravati MP Navneet Rana took a loan of ₹80 lakh from builder and film financier Yusuf Lakdawala, who died in jail in 2021. "Underworld connection of Rana has come up," he said. "Lakdawala was arrested by ED in a money laundering case of ₹200 crore...had links with 'D' gang," Raut added.

130.title: Action to continue against those trying to spread fake news: Anurag Thakur
130.article_body: A day after the government said it has blocked some YouTube news channels, Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Tuesday said such actions will continue against those who spread misinformation and propaganda. "Those trying to spread this kind of propaganda, fake news, myths and fear, strict action will be taken in future, too. We cannot compromise on country’s security," Thakur added.

131.title: Who are the top 10 celebrity influencers on Instagram, as Alia ranked above JLo?
131.article_body: Alia Bhatt has been ranked 6th on the list of top 10 celebrity influencers on Instagram, as per a report by Influencer Marketing Hub. Jennifer Lopez, Chris Hemsworth and Robert Downey Jr have been ranked seventh, ninth and tenth, respectively. Zendaya has topped the list, followed by Tom Holland, The Rock, J-Hope and Will Smith.

132.title: Tomorrow if push comes to shove, pull out of the IPL: Shastri on Kohli's poor form
132.article_body: Referring to Virat Kohli's poor form, ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri said, "This year, he's already into IPL 2022, tomorrow if push comes to shove, pull out of...IPL...for all you care." Shastri added that a break would be ideal for Kohli for prolonging his international career. He further suggested players can even decide to play half of the tournament.

133.title: Mumbai woman fails to repay loan, recovery agent morphs her face on porn video
133.article_body: Mumbai Police have arrested a 19-year-old loan recovery agent from Karnataka for sending a morphed porn video of a woman to her cousin after the victim failed to repay a loan. The victim's cousin got the video on WhatsApp along with a message that said the victim was now working as a sex worker as she failed to repay loan.

134.title: Don't switch off engines at every traffic signal: BMTC to drivers
134.article_body: The Bengaluru Metropolitan Transport Corporation (BMTC) has instructed its midi bus drivers "not to switch off and restart the engine at every traffic signal to avoid an electrical shock circuit". The directive comes after an initial probe into three incidents of midi buses catching fire in the city this year revealed that the fires originated from the engine area.

135.title: K'taka Milk Federation asks K'taka govt to raise milk prices by ₹3/L
135.article_body: The Karnataka Milk Federation (KMF) has proposed to Karnataka government to raise the price of milk by ₹3/litre, citing 25%-30% rise in cost of raw materials and processing of milk. The KMF in its letter to CM Basavaraj Bommai said that other milk cooperatives in Karnataka have already raised milk prices but Nandini milk costs ₹8-10 less compared to them.

136.title: Man booked for sodomising 10-year-old nephew in Ludhiana
136.article_body: A 26-year-old man was booked for allegedly sodomising his 10-year-old nephew in Ludhiana’s Basant Nagar on Tuesday. The minor's parents had left him in the care of the accused man, the victim's mother said. "When we returned, my son said he was hurt and on being prodded he revealed that he had been sexually assaulted by the accused," she added.

137.title: There's Kapoor craze, wished our family to be like that in south: Chiranjeevi
137.article_body: Actor Chiranjeevi said that there is a "Kapoor craze" in the Hindi cinema and that he wished for his family to be like that in south cinema. "I'm so happy to see how these kids (from Pawan Kalyan to Allu Arjun and others) have grown up and made a name for themselves in cinema," Chiranjeevi added.

138.title: France's Atos moves services delivered from Russia to India, Turkey
138.article_body: French IT consulting group Atos is moving its services currently delivered from Russia to other countries, including India and Turkey, amid the ongoing Ukraine-Russia war. Atos said the feasibility of the move has required significant planning in terms of implications for business operations and employees based in Russia. Atos stock lost half of its market value last year.

139.title: Reports of attack on CRPF in Shopian false, it was accident: Police
139.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir's Shopian Police on Tuesday said that media reports claiming an attack on a CRPF party are false. The incident, in which 10 jawans were injured, was actually an accident, it added. It said that the driver lost control over the vehicle due to some technical fault and it skidded off the road and turned turtle.

140.title: TRS celebrates 21-year anniversary, KCR joins plenary meeting in Hyd
140.article_body: Telangana CM and Telangana Rashtra Samithi (TRS) chief K Chandrashekar Rao on Wednesday joined the party's 21-year anniversary celebrations at the Hyderabad International Convention Centre. A plenary meeting of the TRS is being held, where 11 resolutions will be passed. "Two decades ago...Sri KCR Garu founded TRS to make aspirations of Telangana people a reality," Telangana minister KTR tweeted.

141.title: Every game had an individual who stood out: Tewatia on GT winning 6 of 7 games
141.article_body: Talking about their performance in the ongoing IPL season, GT all-rounder Rahul Tewatia said they're not dependent on one or two players to win games and "every game [so far] had an individual who stood out". He added, "This is a team game, team matters. We are happy that there's always someone who ends up [taking responsibility]."

142.title: Cong has to put its house in order with or without consultant: Digvijaya
142.article_body: Congress leader Digvijaya Singh on Wednesday said that ultimately the party has to move and put its house in order, with or without a consultant. His remark came a day after both poll strategist Prashant Kishor and the Congress announced that Kishor has declined the offer to join the party's Empowered Action Group.

143.title: Blood of the Chinese cannot be shed in vain: China as Pak blast kills 3 Chinese teachers
143.article_body: After the suicide attack at the Karachi University which killed three Chinese teachers and injured another, China said, "The blood of the Chinese cannot be shed in vain, and those behind this incident will surely pay the price." China asked Pakistan to scale-up security for its nationals working in the country and demanded a thorough investigation.

144.title: Woman accuses Malayalam actor Vijay Babu of raping her, says 'He recorded my nude video'
144.article_body: A woman has accused Malayalam actor-producer Vijay Babu of raping her multiple times during the past 1.5 months. She stated that Vijay used to intoxicate her and sexually abuse. She also alleged that he recorded a nude video of her, adding, "I fear for his blackmail and for my safety." Vijay has been booked by police.

145.title: Doesn't matter, it's about not having to label everything: Harry on sexuality
145.article_body: Singer Harry Styles said that he has been "really open" about his sexuality with his friends but that it is his personal experience. "The whole point of where we should be heading...which is towards accepting everybody and being more open...is that it doesn't matter...and it's about not having to label everything...not having to clarify what boxes you're checking," he added.

146.title: Fatima fell out of jeep while it was in motion; we got scared: Thar director
146.article_body: 'Thar' director Raj Singh Chaudhary said the cast have put their blood and sweat into the film. He added, "Satish (Kaushik) climbed mountains and Anil (Kapoor)...was riding a bike on terrains." "There was one shot where Fatima...fell out of the jeep while it was in motion and we all got scared but she...brushed herself...and got into the jeep," he said.

147.title: Provide better connectivity to Bharatpur: Raj CM writes to Nitin Gadkari
147.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Tuesday wrote a letter to Union Minister Nitin Gadkari, seeking better road connectivity to Bharatpur, which is known for a popular bird sanctuary. Gehlot demanded an extension of the road connecting Paniyala Mod and Delhi-Mumbai Expressway up to Bharatpur. He further asked the highways minister to declare the Alwar-Bharatpur road as a national highway.

148.title: Trump's Truth Social beating Twitter & TikTok: Musk on pic of Apple Store's top charts
148.article_body: Elon Musk, who's buying Twitter for $44 billion, tweeted a screenshot of Apple Store's top charts. "Truth Social is currently beating Twitter & TikTok on...Apple Store," he wrote. Truth Social, an alt-tech social media platform, was founded by ex-US President Donald Trump in February. "That means you also buy Apple Store now and sort it out," a user jokingly wrote.

149.title: Watched how RCB bowled, kept it on good length: Kuldeep Sen on 4/20
149.article_body: RR pacer Kuldeep Sen, who picked four wickets against RCB, has revealed that he observed how Harshal Patel and Mohammed Siraj bowled and realised that the ball was stopping from a good length. "So, Sanju told me to hit the deck hard, the plan was to keep it on a good length," he added. RR won by 29 runs.

150.title: Robinhood fires 9% full-time employees, cites 'hyper growth'
150.article_body: Citing "hyper growth", Robinhood CEO Vlad Tenev has said the trading platform is firing 9% full-time employees. "This rapid headcount growth has led to some duplicate roles...and more layers and complexity than are optimal," Tenev added. "After carefully considering these factors, we determined that making these reductions to staff is the right decision to improve efficiency," Tenev further said.

151.title: US offers $10 mn reward for information on Russian intelligence officers
151.article_body: The US is offering a reward of up to $10 million for information on six Russian intelligence officers who'd allegedly conducted cyber-attacks affecting key US infrastructure. The officers, working for Russian military intelligence agency GRU, were involved in a 2017 global malware attack that infected the computers of many private US entities, including a hospital system, US State Department said.

152.title: Mumbai's KEM hospital to start paid ward facility from today
152.article_body: The BMC's King Edward Memorial (KEM) hospital, for the first time, will start the facility of 17-bed paid ward on pilot basis from today. The private ward at KEM will have AC beds tentatively priced at ₹1,200 daily and non-AC beds for ₹900 daily, an official said. Until now, BMC-run hospitals provided subsidised treatment and did not charge for beds.

153.title: 12-year-old boy arrested for raping 5-year-old girl in Jharkhand: Police
153.article_body: A 12-year-old boy has been arrested for allegedly raping a five-year-old girl in Torpa Police Station area in Jharkhand's Khunti district, police said on Tuesday. The incident took place on Saturday when the girl went to buy cold drink from a shop near her house, police added. The boy, who was alone there, allegedly raped her, police further said.

154.title: Nothing out of syllabus: Raj minister on Cong-related questions in exam
154.article_body: A day after the Union Ministry of Education wrote to the Rajasthan government over six Congress-related questions in Class XII state Board examination, Education Minister BD Kalla said that nothing was out of syllabus. "The RBSE (Rajasthan Board of Secondary Education) is an autonomous body and there is no interference from the state government," Kalla added.

155.title: 3 in 4 kids have had coronavirus infections in the US: Study
155.article_body: US' CDC researchers have estimated that three out of every four US children have been infected with the coronavirus. They also found that more than half of all Americans had signs of previous infections. In the case of Americans of all ages, about 34% had signs of prior infection in December and two months later 58% did.

156.title: Dad didn't have a childhood; he was on footpaths of Mumbai: Jaaved on Jagdeep
156.article_body: Actor Jaaved Jaaferi said his father Jagdeep didn't have a childhood. He was the bread earner of his family from the age of nine. "After Partition, everything was wiped out. [Dad] was on...streets. He was on...footpaths of Mumbai with his mother. He had to start from scratch," Jaaved added. "He had to fend for himself and his mother," Jaaved said.

157.title: Dad sung song even if he didn't like it, had no other way to earn money: Aditya
157.article_body: Singer Aditya Narayan said his father and singer Udit Narayan and his colleagues had to sing a song even if they didn't like it back in the day because there was no other way for them to earn money. "I'm earning my bread and butter from my career as host...So, I do not have to...compromise on my music," he added.

158.title: 2 men arrested for kidnapping 17-year-old girl in Mumbai
158.article_body: Two men have been arrested for kidnapping a 17-year-old girl in Mumbai, police said on Tuesday. The girl reportedly went missing on April 8 following which her mother filed a police complaint. According to police, the girl used her mother's mobile phone. "We...tracked down the most called number's location and found the girl in Juhu," a police officer said.

159.title: Delhi Metro begins constructing 5th bridge over river Yamuna
159.article_body: Delhi Metro has started work on a fifth bridge across river Yamuna under Phase-IV expansion of the Pink Line, officials said on Tuesday. The bridge, which is 560 metres long, will connect the Soorghat metro station with Sonia Vihar metro station on the corridor. "Pile foundation work is near completion...approximately 50% of sub-structure has been completed," a DMRC official said.

160.title: He will be hungry to perform: Piyush Chawla on Shubman Gill
160.article_body: Ahead of GT's match against SRH, cricketer-commentator Piyush Chawla said GT opener Shubman Gill will be hungry to perform after scoring a total of 27 runs in his last four games in IPL 2022. "Shubman did score runs in the initial matches but then hasn't been in great form," added Chawla. In GT's seven games, Shubman has scored 207 runs.

161.title: Saudi Arabia to buy 1 lakh EVs over 10 yrs: Luxury EV maker Lucid
161.article_body: Luxury EV maker Lucid has said that the government of Saudi Arabia has agreed to buy up to one lakh of its electric vehicles over the next ten years. Saudi Arabia's initial orders will be between 1,000 and 2,000 vehicles per year starting in 2023. It has committed to purchase 50,000 vehicles, with an option to buy an additional 50,000.

162.title: Ex-Myanmar leader Suu Kyi handed 5 year jail term for accepting $600,000 cash
162.article_body: A court in military-ruled Myanmar has sentenced ex-leader Aung San Suu Kyi to five years in jail after finding her guilty of corruption, Reuters reported quoting a source with knowledge of proceedings. The case centred on allegations that Suu Kyi accepted 11.4 kg of gold and cash payments totalling $600,000 from former Yangon chief minister Phyo Min Thein.

163.title: Did 17-18 films after 'Om..'; didn't have guidance, left good projects: Yuvika
163.article_body: Actress Yuvika Chaudhary said that she did 17-18 films after 'Om Shanti Om' but because she did not have guidance, she left a few "very good projects". "When you have no guidance in life or no godfather, it is a little different as you end up signing films. Then you feel you shouldn't have," she added.

164.title: Fire breaks out at SDMC scrapyard in Delhi, 12 fire tenders deployed
164.article_body: A fire broke out at a South Delhi Municipal Corporation (SDMC) scrapyard in Swami Nagar district park on Wednesday. No casualties have been reported, the fire department said. "We received a call around 3:45 am. 12 fire tenders were on the operation...around 4:25 am, it was marked as an A-4 category...it upgraded to A-6 around 4:55 am," an official said.

165.title: Karachi suicide bomber had master's degree, was mother of 2 and wife of dentist
165.article_body: Baloch Liberation Army has identified the Karachi bomber as 30-year-old Shaari Baloch or Bramsh, saying she was the group's first female bomber. She had a master's in Zoology, was pursuing MPhil and was working as a science teacher in a secondary school. Further, Afghan journalist Bashir Ahmad Gwakh said Baloch has two kids and her husband is a dentist.

166.title: Amber Heard suffers from 2 personality disorders, says psychologist hired by Depp
166.article_body: Psychologist Dr Shannon Curry, who was hired by Johnny Depp's legal team, told the court that Amber Heard suffers from borderline and histrionic personality disorders. Curry said Heard "externalises blame" and can be "self-righteous", "judgemental" and has anger. She added that people with such disorders "make threats using the legal system, threaten to file for a restraining order, claim abuse".

167.title: Amber didn't have PTSD, she exaggerated she had 19 of 20 major symptoms: Psychologist
167.article_body: While testifying in Johnny Depp's defamation trial against his ex-wife Amber Heard, psychologist Dr Shannon Curry said that Amber didn't have post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD). She further suggested that Amber "grossly exaggerated" that she had 19 out of 20 of the major symptoms for PTSD. "That’s not typical of even somebody with the most disabling form of PTSD," Curry said.

168.title: Govts under BJP's control practising politics of hate: 108 ex-bureaucrats to PM
168.article_body: Stating that governments under BJP's control are "assiduously practising politics of hate", 108 ex-bureaucrats, in a letter to PM Narendra Modi, wrote, "It's our fond hope that in this year of 'Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav'...you will call for an end to it." "The idea of India that our founding fathers had envisioned...needs a climate of...communal harmony to thrive," they said.

169.title: Both Anil Deshmukh, Nawab Malik have been framed: Sanjay Raut
169.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Tuesday said that whether it’s former Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh or Maharashtra minister Nawab Malik, both have been "framed". "The Chandiwal Commission has submitted the report to the government. I have not seen it but we are saying from the beginning that the accusations are false," Raut added.

170.title: Russia to halt gas supplies to Poland & Bulgaria
170.article_body: Russian energy firm Gazprom has told Poland and Bulgaria that it'll stop supplying gas to the two countries from Wednesday. It comes after Russian President Vladimir Putin demanded "unfriendly'' countries to pay Gazprom in rubles instead of other currencies after sanctions were levied against his nation over the Ukraine invasion. Both Poland and Bulgaria have refused to pay in rubles.

171.title: Mumbai Police Commissioner wants to join Shiv Sena: Kirit Somaiya
171.article_body: BJP's Kirit Somaiya alleged that Mumbai Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey ordered a police officer not to register his FIR as he wants to join Shiv Sena after 1.5 months. "We will go to Governor soon and if necessary also to HC to discuss this matter," Somaiya said. On Sunday, Somaiya had alleged that he was attacked by Shiv Sena's "gundas".

172.title: Feroz got angry if someone goofed up, gave them money at night: Writer Suparn
172.article_body: Writer Suparn Varma said that late actor Feroz Khan used to get angry if someone goofed up on set and would give the person an earful. "But he would...call the same person to his suite at night...give him bottle of Black Label, money...and make him feel good," Suparn said. He added the actor loved and hated in equal measure.

173.title: AMD Days Sale is now live on Flipkart
173.article_body: AMD announced AMD Days Sale on Flipkart featuring offers on laptops, desktops, and AIOs for casual, enthusiast, professional gamers, students, and working professionals. The sale will be live on 27th-28th April for customers to get extra ₹1,000 off on prepaid orders and up to 12 months of No Cost EMI on a range of laptops powered by AMD Ryzen™ processors.

174.title: RR have shown faith in me, I'm paying them back: Riyan Parag
174.article_body: RR all-rounder Riyan Parag, who was named Man of the Match for his performance against RCB, has said that he's paying RR back "bit by bit" for showing faith in him for the last three years. "A bit of satisfaction...I love pressure and I'm just showcasing my abilities," he added. Riyan scored unbeaten 56 runs to help RR post 144/8.

175.title: DTC bus catches fire near Delhi's Shanti Van; 3rd such incident in a month
175.article_body: A Delhi Transport Corporation (DTC) bus caught fire near Shanti Van on Tuesday, making it the third such incident in a month.
