This comes amid Chyna's defamation suit against the Kardashian family for purposefully interfering with her contract on Kylie's brother Rob and Chyna's spin-off of Keeping Up With the Kardashians.

351.title: Trailer looks familiar yet different: Vidya on 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'
351.article_body: Actress Vidya Balan on Tuesday shared the trailer of film 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' on social media, writing, "The trailer looks familiar yet different...Can't wait to experience this roller-coaster ride again." Vidya had portrayed the role of Avni who had dissociative identity disorder and believed herself to be Manjulika in the first film. The sequel stars Kartik Aaryan and Kiara Advani.

352.title: PM Modi to interact with CMs on COVID-19 situation tomorrow
352.article_body: PM Narendra Modi will interact with Chief Ministers of all states via video conferencing on Wednesday over the prevailing COVID-19 situation in India. This comes as some states and UTs, including Delhi, are reporting a rise in daily COVID-19 cases. According to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare, India reported over 2,000 COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours.

353.title: Police use water cannon to diffuse BJP rally protesting against Mamata govt
353.article_body: West Bengal Police on Tuesday dispersed BJP workers who were taking out a protest rally, led by BJP's Tejasvi Surya against Mamata Banerjee led government in the state with a water cannon. Meanwhile, Tejasvi Surya was on Tuesday asked by the Delhi Police to join the investigation in connection with alleged vandalism at Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal's residence.

354.title: ED raids ABG Shipyard premises in India's biggest bank fraud case: Reports
354.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) reportedly carried out raids at 26 premises linked to Mumbai-based ABG Shipyard on Tuesday. The company is accused of defrauding 28 banks of ₹22,842 crore in India's biggest bank fraud case ever. The raids were conducted at multiple premises of ABG Shipyard, its sister companies, as well as executives, in Mumbai, Pune and Surat, reports said.

355.title: Death Of Remakes: RGV on Bollywood remakes of South films
355.article_body: Filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma posted a series of tweets criticising Bollywood remakes of South films with the hashtag #DeathOfRemakes. He wrote if Nani-starrer Telugu film 'Jersey' was dubbed, it would've cost ₹10 lakh, while the Shahid Kapoor-starrer remake cost ₹100 crore which lost "enormous money...and face". "#Pushpa #RRR #KGF2...doing far better than originals if...content is good," he added.

356.title: SEBI attaches Greentouch Projects' assets in illegal fundraising case
356.article_body: Market regulator SEBI has attached 14 properties related to Greentouch Projects and its four directors in an illegal fundraising case to recover ₹56 crore of investors' money. The attached properties include land parcels, plots, office spaces and a flat located in West Bengal and Uttar Pradesh. The company claims to have already repaid over ₹12.24 crore to its investors.

357.title: B'luru Police arrest man for drug peddling, seize drugs worth ₹6.5 lakh
357.article_body: Bengaluru Police have arrested a man for drug peddling in the city and seized drugs estimated to be around ₹6.5 lakh from his possession, the city's Joint Commissioner of Police (Crime), Raman Gupta, said. The drugs, which have been recovered, include MDMA crystal, ecstasy pills and chassis. Further, a mobile phone, laptop and electronic weighing machine have also been recovered.

358.title: Europe must look beyond Ukraine, world threw Afghanistan under the bus: Jaishankar
358.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar, while responding to questions on the Russia-Ukraine war from European leaders, said it was a "wake-up call" for Europe to look at pressing issues in other parts of the world. Referring to challenges that Asia is facing, Jaishankar said, "Less than a year ago in Afghanistan...an entire...society was thrown under the bus by the world."

359.title: JNU may be politically charged, but isn't anti-national: VC
359.article_body: Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) Vice Chancellor Santishree Dhulipudi Pandit said the university may be "politically charged" but it's not "anti-national". "More than 60% of the bureaucracy...is from this very university. Over 90% of the students are apolitical, and they've come here to make a career...[any] negative branding will affect them when they go out to get jobs," Pandit said.

360.title: 2 children among 4 dead after shooting at Russian school: Report
360.article_body: Three individuals, including a teacher and two children, were shot dead after a man opened fire at kindergarten school in Russia's Ulyanovsk region on Tuesday, local authorities told AFP. The accused, whose identity is yet to be revealed, reportedly killed himself after attack. The ages of the dead children would be between 3 and 6 years old, an official said.

361.title: Twitter Co-founder Dorsey eligible for $978 mn cash payout after Musk's deal: Reports
361.article_body: Twitter Co-founder and former CEO Jack Dorsey, who owns a 2.4% stake in the company, is eligible for a $978 million cash payout after Elon Musk's acquisition of Twitter for $44 billion, according to reports. According to Musk's deal, he would be buying about 18,042,428 shares of Twitter that are owned by Dorsey for $54.20 each, the reports added.

362.title: Railways must pay compensation if person falls off crowded train: HC
362.article_body: The Bombay High Court said that Railways will have to pay compensation to people who suffer injuries after falling while attempting to board an overcrowded train. The court also directed Western Railways to pay ₹3 lakh to a man who was injured after falling off an overcrowded local train. In 2013, Railway Claims Tribunal had rejected the victim's compensation claim.

363.title: CM KCR lays foundation stone for 3 super-speciality hospitals in Hyd
363.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao on Tuesday laid the foundation stone for three Telangana Institute of Medical Sciences (TIMS) super-speciality hospitals in Hyderabad. The three hospitals, for which the state government has already sanctioned the amount of ₹2,679 crore, will be established at LB Nagar, Sanathnagar and Alwal. Health Minister T Harish Rao and other ministers also accompanied the CM.

364.title: Aren't Hindi films remade in South? Abhishek Bachchan on remakes
364.article_body: Actor Abhishek Bachchan, on being asked about Bollywood remakes of South Indian films, said, "Are you telling me...Hindi films aren't...remade in the South?" He further said that films have always been remade and it's not a new phenomenon. "The exchange doesn't happen because there is a dearth of ideas...It is a choice we make as a creator," the actor added.

365.title: Jakhar wishes Congress luck as panel recommends his 2-year suspension
365.article_body: Shortly after the Congress disciplinary panel recommended his two-year suspension on Tuesday, former Punjab Congress chief Sunil Jakhar wished his party good luck. The party's disciplinary committee had on April 11 given a show-cause notice to Jakhar for alleged anti-party activities and sought a reply within a week. He had called former Punjab chief minister Charanjit Singh Channi a liability.

366.title: Will move heaven & Earth to help Ukraine win battle against Russia: US
366.article_body: US Defence Secretary Lloyd Austin on Tuesday vowed to move "heaven and earth" to "help Ukraine win the fight against Russia's unjust invasion", as allies from 40 nations met to bolster Kyiv's defence against Moscow. Austin added that US and its allies have committed over $5 billion of equipment to support Ukraine's defence since the war began on February 24.

367.title: Ukraine war could be wake-up call for Europe to look at Asia's situation: EAM
367.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said the Russia-Ukraine war could be a "wake-up call" for Europe to also look at Asia's situation. "Things have been happening in Asia for the last 10 years. Europe may not have looked at it," he said. It's important to recognise that the "rules-based order has been under continuous stress" in Asia, Jaishankar added.

368.title: More than me Congress needs leadership: Prashant Kishor after declining to join party
368.article_body: After declining to join Congress, poll strategist Prashant Kishor tweeted, "In my humble opinion, more than me the party needs leadership and collective will to fix the deep rooted structural problems through transformational reforms." He declined the offer to join the party's Empowered Action Group and also to take responsibility for elections.

369.title: Quite surprising: Vettori on PBKS' Rishi Dhawan bowling the final over vs CSK
369.article_body: Reacting to PBKS all-rounder Rishi Dhawan bowling the final over in PBKS' win against CSK, ex-New Zealand captain Daniel Vettori said, "I can't imagine...they had planned on giving him the final over, it was quite surprising." Discussing CSK captain Ravindra Jadeja's unbeaten 21 off 16 balls, Vettori said Jadeja could have been a "little more" aggressive.

370.title: Ukraine's problems today will be ours tomorrow: Estonian PM amid war
370.article_body: Speaking about Russian invasion of Ukraine, Estonian PM Kaja Kallas said in an interview that Ukraine's problems today will be "our problems tomorrow". Kallas added that countries, including Germany, should adopt a more assertive role in ending the war in Ukraine so as to lessen burden of war refugees. "NATO is a defensive alliance, we're in this together," she added.

371.title: Biden pardons ex-Secret Service agent, reduces sentences for 75 others
371.article_body: US President Joe Biden issued three pardons and 75 prison sentence commutations in his first grants of clemency. All the commutations and two of the three pardons went to people convicted of federal drug offences. The third pardon was given to an 86-year-old ex-US Secret Service agent, Abraham Bolden Sr, who was the first African-American to serve on presidential detail.

372.title: Ranveer dances with Alia to Dholida in BTS video from Gangubai Kathiawadi sets
372.article_body: Ranveer Singh danced with Alia Bhatt on her song 'Dholida' from 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' during the filming of the music video. Saregama Music shared a behind-the-scenes video of the making of the song. Speaking about Dholida in the clip, Ranveer said, "The song is [a] hit." He then performs the hook step of the song with Alia and the background dancers.

373.title: 2 die as wall collapses in Delhi's Keshav Puram, 2nd incident in 24 hrs
373.article_body: Two people died as a wall collapsed in Delhi's Keshav Puram area as the national capital reported a second similar incident in the last 24 hours. "The two persons were rescued from under the debris and rushed to Deep Chand Bandhu Hospital where the doctors declared them brought dead," said Deputy Commissioner of Police (northwest) Usha Rangnani.

374.title: Honorarium of mid-day meal cooks increased by the UP Cabinet
374.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh government in a meeting chaired by UP CM Yogi Adityanath approved a proposal to raise the honorarium of mid-day meal cooks posted in the state's Basic Education Department. The honorarium of 3,77,520 cooks, engaged in preparing food in the schools under the mid-day meal scheme, has been raised from ₹1,500 to ₹2,000.

375.title: 32.79 lakh foreigners visited India in 2020 despite restrictions: MHA
375.article_body: More than 32.79 lakh foreigners visited India in 2020 despite restrictions, according to a report by the Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA). The maximum number of foreigners who visited India between April 1, 2020, and December 31, 2020, were from the US (61,190). This was followed by people from Bangladesh (37,774), the UK (33,323) and Canada (13,707), the report added.

376.title: Crew was in Ukraine before war, can't contact 3 actors: 'Love in..' director
376.article_body: Filmmaker Nitin Gupta said that the entire crew of his film 'Love in Ukraine' was in Ukraine before the war started and that they are unable to contact three actors now. "Liza, who is also from Ukraine, is stuck somewhere at the Ukraine border and efforts are being made to bring her to India for the film promotions," he added.

377.title: Aarohi came into my life & changed everything: Shraddha on 9 yrs of Aashiqui 2
377.article_body: As her film 'Aashiqui 2' completed nine years of release on Tuesday, actress Shraddha Kapoor said, "Aarohi (her character's name) came into my life, and changed everything." "I am forever grateful and thankful to each and everyone who gave so much love to me as Aarohi," she added. Directed by Mohit Suri, 'Aashiqui 2' also starred Aditya Roy Kapur.

378.title: Ranbir says 'Say hi to my wife' post varmala with Alia, video goes viral
378.article_body: A video of actor Ranbir Kapoor introducing actress Alia Bhatt after their varmala ceremony at their wedding has surfaced online. In the video, Ranbir can be heard saying, "Say hi to my wife." To this, Alia also greeted everyone. Ranbir can be seen kneeling in the video while the varmalas were being exchanged between the two.

379.title: Anil Deshmukh gets clean chit in money laundering case
379.article_body: Chandiwal Commission has given a clean chit to  former Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh in a money laundering case. The one member high-level enquiry commission was chaired by Justice (retired) Kailash Chandiwal to probe corruption allegations levelled by former Mumbai Police Commissioner Param Bir Singh against Deshmukh. The commission's report was also submitted to CM Uddhav Thackeray.

380.title: Man kills second wife over her 'argumentative nature' in Delhi
380.article_body: A 36-year-old man allegedly killed his second wife in Delhi's Narela area, police said on Monday. The deceased woman was initially raped by her husband's friend and she was later strangulated to death by her husband, police said. According to the police, the accused man said that he was fed up with his wife as she had an argumentative nature.

381.title: Farhan proposed to me for marriage in Maldives; it was unexpected: Shibani
381.article_body: Shibani Dandekar revealed Farhan Akhtar proposed to her for marriage in the Maldives. She said it was "very unexpected." Shibani added she had no idea about it. "We hadn't even discussed it. But this is again Farhan, when he decides something, he does it," she said. Shibani further added she wasn't the kind of person who wanted to get married.

382.title: Was there nothing better to do with $44 billion: Simu on Musk's Twitter takeover
382.article_body: Hollywood celebrities reacted to Elon Musk's $44-billion Twitter deal. Shang-Chi actor, Simu Liu tweeted, "Was there nothing better to do with 44 billion dollars?" Priyanka Chopra's brother-in-law, singer Kevin Jonas wrote, "Will we now get the edit tweet option?" In a joint statement with Twitter, Musk said that he wants to make the Twitter service "better than ever".

383.title: SC agrees to list pleas challenging K'taka HC's hijab ban in educational institutions
383.article_body: The Supreme Court on Tuesday agreed to list appeals challenging the Karnataka High Court order upholding the hijab ban in educational institutions. CJI NV Ramana asked senior advocate Meenakshi Arora to "wait for two days" when she mentioned the matter and said that he will list it soon. CJI Ramana has also urged parties not to sensationalise the matter.

384.title: Didn't want them without purpose: 'Bhool...' maker on not casting Akshay, Vidya
384.article_body: Filmmaker Anees Bazmee, while speaking about not casting Vidya Balan and Akshay Kumar in 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2', said, "The script didn't give us the liberty to bring them onboard." "We didn't want to bring the two onboard without any purpose...This story did not permit us to bring them," he added. The upcoming film stars Kartik Aaryan, Kiara Advani and Tabu.

385.title: So many roles and genres still haven't come my way: Saif Ali Khan
385.article_body: Actor Saif Ali Khan has said that there are several roles and genres that have not come his way. However, he added, "It's not really about the genre. It's about doing the same thing differently and doing it better." "So, even the roles that I've...done, I think I would approach them differently [if I do them now]," Saif further stated.

386.title: I felt a 'blinding hurt': Depp on reading ex-wife Amber Heard's op-ed
386.article_body: Actor Johnny Depp said he felt a "blinding hurt" after reading ex-wife Amber Heard's op-ed which claimed that Heard was a victim of domestic violence. "It was like somebody had hit me in the back of the head with a 2x4," added Depp. Depp has sued Heard for defamation over her op-ed which was written in 2018.

387.title: Aus, NZ decide not to send athletes for this year's Asian Games
387.article_body: Australia will not be sending its athletes to the Asian Games for the first time this year and similarly, New Zealand has confirmed that their athletes too won't be going to Hangzhou in September this year. Notably, the Olympic Council of Asia (OCA) had invited a quota of around 450 contingent members from Oceania nations, including Australia and New Zealand.

388.title: Tibetans being forced to speak Chinese: Report
388.article_body: Officials from China are forcing people in rural Tibet to speak in Chinese, a report said. It is part of China's campaign to restrict Tibetans from using their native languages, it added. A 10-day workshop was reportedly conducted in Kongpo to promote Chinese as the main language of communication. The local administrators were asked to conduct business only in Chinese.

389.title: Cancer patient posts pic of him giving interview amid treatment, gets hired
389.article_body: A cancer patient's post on recruiters rejecting him due to the disease has gone viral. Posting a picture of him giving an interview amid chemo, Arsh Prasad said, "I don't need...sympathy! I'm here to prove myself." Applied Cloud Computing CEO Nilesh Satpute commented, "Please stop attending interviews...I checked your credentials, they're very strong. You can join us...There'll be no interview."

390.title: Disney rejects Saudi's demand to cut LGBT scene in Doctor Strange 2
390.article_body: Disney has refused Saudi Arabia's demand to cut same-sex relationship references from 'Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness'. A Saudi official stated that the film will never be banned in the country but they are still negotiating with Disney. Earlier, Warner Bros had been criticised for cutting same-sex romance references in 'Fantastic Beasts: The Secrets of Dumbledore' for China.

391.title: TN man gets death penalty for beheading minor Dalit girl for rejecting advances
391.article_body: A court in Tamil Nadu awarded death sentence to a 26-year-old man for beheading a minor Dalit girl for allegedly rejecting his sexual advances. The incident occurred on October 22, 2018, when the accused, identified as Dinesh Kumar, barged into the house of the 14-year-old victim and killed her. The accused had also attacked the girl's mother.

392.title: My intro in 'Parinda' is one of the world's 'worst' performances: Anil
392.article_body: Discussing his 1989 film 'Parinda', actor Anil Kapoor said, "My introduction [sequence]...is one of the worst performances in the world. I want to reshoot it." "I was being my full-on self," added Anil. 'Parinda' also starred actor Jackie Shroff who had earlier revealed that he slapped Anil 17 times for a scene in the film.

393.title: 6th round of sanctions against Russia expected very soon: EU
393.article_body: The European Union's energy policy chief Kadri Simson said a sixth package of sanctions against Russia over Ukraine invasion is expected "very soon". Reportedly, the sixth package may include some form of oil embargo. In its previous packages, the 27-nation bloc had backed a ban on coal and removed a number of Russian banks from the SWIFT financial system.

394.title: Human Rights Watch head to step down after nearly 3 decades
394.article_body: Human Rights Watch (HRW) Executive Director Kenneth Roth said he'd step down at the end of August after running the global rights watchdog for nearly three decades. "Under Roth's leadership, HRW grew from a staff of about 60 with a $7 million budget to 552 covering over 100 countries and a nearly $100 million budget," the New York-based group said.

395.title: I've grown up watching Akshay, it's better not to compare: Kartik on 'Bhool..'
395.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan said that it is better to not compare him with Akshay Kumar in 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'. "I can't compare because it's too big a shoe to fill. I had loved him in Bhool Bhulaiyaa 1, and have grown up watching him...Comparisons will happen...but I hope 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' will be remembered as a new film," he added.

396.title: Was aware of CSK's plan to bowl wide yorkers at me: Dhawan
396.article_body: After scoring an unbeaten 88(59) against CSK on Monday, Punjab Kings batter Shikhar Dhawan has said that he was aware of CSK bowlers' plan "to bowl wide yorkers" at him. "During my innings, I had in my mind intentions to attack the shorter side of the field, though not a specific bowler...I was aware of their plans," Dhawan said.

397.title: Fire breaks out in Delhi's Lajpat Nagar; 9 fire tenders on spot
397.article_body: A fire broke out in the Amar Colony area of Delhi's Lajpat Nagar on Tuesday afternoon, ANI reported. Following the incident, around nine fire tenders were rushed to the spot to douse the flames. A video shared by ANI showed smoke billowing out of the building in Amar Colony. However, no casualties have been reported in the incident so far.

398.title: Gujarat policeman arrested for taking ₹2 lakh bribe in Gurugram
398.article_body: A police inspector, Jagdish Chaudhary, of the Gujarat Police was caught red-handed accepting a bribe of ₹2 lakh from a Gurugram resident in Sector 49 on Sunday, officials said on Monday. Chaudhary had given an assurance to weaken a cheating case against the complainant's nephew, according to officials. Chaudhary had accepted ₹1 lakh from the complainant on April 12.

399.title: Mumbai Police video shows MP-MLA couple having tea in custody after ill-treatment claim
399.article_body: After Amravati MP Navneet Rana alleged "inhumane treatment" by police, Mumbai Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey shared a video showing Navneet and her husband MLA Ravi Rana having tea in the Khar Police Station. "Do we say anything more," the Police chief captioned the video. Meanwhile, the Union Home Ministry has sought a factual report from Maharashtra government over Navneet's allegation.

400.title: Section 144 imposed in Maharashtra's Aurangabad ahead of Raj Thackeray's rally
400.article_body: Section 144 of CrPC has been imposed in Maharashtra's Aurangabad, ahead of MNS chief Raj Thackeray's rally on May 1. Restrictions will remain in force in the district till May 9. Thackeray had earlier announced the rally to protest against the recital of 'azaan' from loudspeakers at mosques and had demanded the removal of these loudspeakers by May 3.

401.title: People took me more seriously after 'Dil Dhadakne Do': Pawan Chopra
401.article_body: Actor Pawan Chopra said people started taking him more "seriously" after his performance in the film 'Dil Dhadakne Do', which also starred Ranveer Singh, Anushka Sharma. "Filmmakers now have the conviction that I can pull off any character," added Pawan. Pawan stated that he started working in films as it was not exciting playing the same roles in television shows.

402.title: Depp's a huge narcissist, he was overacting during the trial: Howard Stern
402.article_body: Discussing actor Johnny Depp's ongoing defamation trial against ex-wife Amber Heard, American radio personality Howard Stern said, "The reason he wanted...it televised [is because] that's what narcissists do." "Depp is a huge narcissist," added Stern. "I will play you some clips from the...trial. Depp's so overacting because he's writing his own material as he goes along," stated Stern.

403.title: Operation Romeo's Sidhant to star in Vikramaditya's series on film industry
403.article_body: Sidhant Gupta, who was most recently seen in the film 'Operation Romeo', has reportedly teamed up with filmmaker Vikramaditya Motwane for a new series, tentatively titled 'Stardust'. According to reports, the eight-episode series is inspired by true events and will highlight the work culture of the film industry. The makers are planning to release the show this year, reports stated.

404.title: Usyk to raise funds for Ukraine through his bout against Joshua: Report
404.article_body: Olympic gold medallist boxer Oleksandr Usyk will raise relief funds for his native Ukraine through his bout against UK's Anthony Joshua which is expected to be held later this year. "Many people in Ukraine are now seeking help. We think that as soon as it's released, many people will actually receive this help," the unified heavyweight champion told Reuters.
